Ну, что тут сказать... Valve умеет делать хорошие игры. У первого эпизода захватывающий сюжет, места инновационный геймплей, но главный минус - это длина. Игра проходится всего за 4-5 часов, что-то, на мой взгляд, маловато.

As Crab said in his recommendation: "Nothing happens in this game... I mean really you can skip it." Of course there is a grain of truth in that statement, when held in the light of Episode 2 or even Half-Life 2, Episode One leaves much to be admired. This can be attributed to the games eco-centric location throughout the ruins of City 17 and the Citadel and the lack of varying companions throughout the game. While doing an excellent job making Alyx seem like a more believable character with well scripted combat sequences and animations you can't help but feel that she's holding your hand through it all. Personally I loved EP1 because the raw urban combat of the final levels of Half-Life 2 were my favorite levels, and Episode One extended on that making for an entire game focused on the best part of HL2. All that being said it's not imperative that you play it, and you can go from HL2 straight to EP2 without worry about missing on vital story points.

Très bon jeu, même si un peu moins bien que Half-Life 2.
Alyx Vance est un très bon personnage secondaire, non sexualisé,  à des lieues des personnages féminins clichés des autres jeux.

Disappointingly short, but nonetheless an essential game to play if you liked Half Life 2 (which should be just about everyone out there...) The first part of the episode with the gravity gun might not be everyone's cup of tea, but the story is still great and the gameplay fun, with a good mix of fighting and physics-based puzzles. Highly recommended, although perhaps quite up there with Half Life 2. These days the length shouldn't be a problem, because Episode 2 is available for you to play immediately after the conclusion of episode one.

Fun FPS game for any fan of the series. HL2 Deathmatch is a great bonus.
Excellent expansion. New interesting physics puzzles are added, but you’re going to miss some new weapons.

Exponential Decay 2: Episode 1 sees the Valve fanbase begging Jack Thompson to stop being such a giant prick and let Gedeon play the vidya. He reluctantly agrees, and everyone can click on resume game, to be reunited with Gedeon's love interest; Alonso, and her Feline robot companion. Everyone realizes that da poreec staet is committing harakiri, and so Gedeon shits his HIV suit because he's walking around in irradiated reactor core chambers without a fucking helmet, the dumb fuck. Everyone gets cancer and the game ends. Gaben starts gaining weight, in preparation for his famous line in Episode 2's developer commentary.
Я и забыл, что первый эпизод настолько хорош, рекомендую всем перепройти, ну или пройти если вы до сих пор это не сделали!!!

ALL IN ALL, GTA: LOS ANGELES IS A GOOD GAME, WOULD BUY AGAIN. 6 STARS

Невероятные выражения лиц, реагирующих как в жизни на ту или иную ситуацию. Я еще не встречал ни одну игру, которая бы уделила бы столько внимания разработке персонажей.

Episode 1 continues the Half-Life saga where Half-Life 2 left off, and is perhaps one of the tightest corridor shooter experiences available. Intense from start to finish, this game is frantic without ever being overwhelming. Put aside enough time to complete it in one sitting, because it's hard to put down.

The equivalent of a filler episode. You could probably go right from HL2 into episode 2 because of how little happens in this episode. It's still a Valve game and has it's moments but it's plot is stretched thin between predictable puzzles and fights. Worth playing if you get it in a bundle but I wouldn't recommending purchasing it on it's own.

...esta é apenas a "expansão um" da recomendação que fiz do HL 2. A Valve é uma das poucas desenvolvedoras que tem o dom de preservar e dar sequência a um jogo, sem destruir a continuidade do seu trabalho anterior. Espero que continue sempre assim.

Of course that you play HL2, and Episode One will be a logical purshace. This is not only E1 to be sequel, but it is so good like first.

A sequel to a sequel thats the first episode of a series in a series... so confused. This game doesn't feel like a flow blown sequel but rather an extremely large standalone DLC episode. The game is rather short, but everything feels polished. There is all the best the series has to offer in here. The game is entirely based around escaping from City 17, which is now falling apart. This game expands the story, gives you new enemies to face, and throws you into unique lsituations in various locations. The biggest feature is that you are with Alyx nearly the whole game. She is a great character and while she takes away from the ambience of being alone, her AI is great so she is never useless or annoying. This game feels like a set up for bigger things to come, but this game does provide plenty of fun and challenges.

Это очень качественная, динамичная и яркая игра. Из неё убрано всё лишнее, всё скучное, всё мешающее игроку спокойно получать удовольствие. Она берёт игрока за руку сразу после прогремевшего в конце Half-Life 2 взрыва и терпеливо тащит за собой до самого конца. 
Нет больше никакой утомительной езды на транспорте, долгих диалогов, сложных сюжетных поворотов... Есть только рельсы насыщенного заскриптованного геймплея, по которым придётся ехать до самого финала.
Золотой век VALVE

Embora tenha simplesmente surtado com a obra-prima que é HL2, não senti a mesma coisa com o Episode One. Continua sendo Half-Life, e a mecânica e história são interessantíssimos, porém acho que ficou curta a trama. CURTA DEMAIS. Eu não gosto de jogos demasiados longos porque não tenho tempo ou saco para jogar. HL não é muito meu estilo: silencioso, muito suspense e tal. Portanto, ele ser curto me agrada, como é HL2. Só que esse aqui quando cheguei na parte que achei que seria o clímax, era na verdade o final do jogo. Fiquei indignado. Mas simplesmente amei o jogo. Texto contraditório né? Recomendo mesmo assim.

With HDR updates, a better facial animation system and more of the same fantastic universe to play in, Half Life 2 : Episode one is an easy recommendation. Even the short play time isn't an issue with many well crafted, memorable scenes. Pick it up as part of the orange box because the only way to top this episode was, well, with the next one.
